729424f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Bard Avenue
729424f-a.text:
Richmiond Terrace, adjoining the N.E. corner of Bard avenue, showing the Livingston depot of the Staten Island Railroad. This house, which has been converted into a railroad station, was the home of A. Livingston (Beers's 1874 map). The view is eastward.
October 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
729424f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Bard Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729426f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Bard Avenue
729426f-a.text:
Richmond Terrace, north side, between Bard and Davis Avenues, showing the service building of the Staten Island Edison Corporation.
The view is west.
April 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
729426f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Bard Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729425f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Bard Avenue
729425f-a.text:
Richmond Terrace, at the N. W. corner of Bard Avenue. Beers 'a 1874 map shows the house to have
belonged to Dr. Elliott.
July 5, 1932
P. L. Sperr
729425f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Bard Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729479f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Bard Avenue
729479f-a.text:
1116 Richmond Terrace, adjoining the S. E. corner of Bard Avenue. The house belonged to F. G. Shaw in 1874; to the Rogart Estate in 1898, and again to the Shaw family from 1907 to 1917. Dates refer to mpas on which the owners'
hnames appear.
July S, 1932
LL. Sperr
729479f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Bard Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729480f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Bard Avenue
729480f-b.text:
(1)
1126 Richmond Terrace, at the S.E. corner of Bard Avenue, showing the Weston mansion. The insurance atlases from 1874 to 1917 show it to have belonged to
the above family.
July 5, 1932
P.L.Sperr
(2)
The same, showing the Bard Avenue side of the house.
July 5, 1932
P.L.Sperr
